title: Back on Track: Bajrang Punia and Vinesh Phogat Resume International Training After Wrestling Federation Controversy
content:
After months of protest against the Wrestling Federation of India,  Olympic medalists Bajrang Punia and Vinesh Phogat are finally back on the international training circuit. 

Punia will head to Kyrgyzstan for a 36-day training camp, while Phogat will first train in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan before moving to Hungary for an 18-day stint. Both wrestlers are aiming to regain their focus and prepare for upcoming competitions. 

This marks a significant step forward for the wrestlers, who have been vocal in their fight for justice and accountability within the federation.
author: Scroll Staff
